meanings.definition: An ancient method of writing in which lines are inscribed alternately from left to right and right to left.
meanings.sent1: In boustrophedon writing, the text flows back and forth like a gentle wave.
meanings.sent2: The ancient scribe used boustrophedon to fill the papyrus efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The teacher tried boustrophedon on the whiteboard, but the students found it confusing.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts moved boustrophedon, switching direction with each new idea.
meanings.sent5: The boustrophedon script looked like a dance of letters across the page.

meanings.definition: A pattern of plowing fields in which the plow is turned at the end of each row to create a zigzag pattern.
meanings.sent1: The farmer followed the boustrophedon method to cover the entire field efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The boustrophedon furrows created an interesting design in the soil.
meanings.sent3: The boustrophedon plowing made the field look like a giant puzzle from above.
meanings.sent4: The boustrophedon rows resembled a winding river cutting through the land.
meanings.sent5: The boustrophedon pattern allowed for better water drainage in the field.
